sections.text:
This feature will make the deployment readiness compliance checklist context-aware by automatically determining which requirements apply based on the customer and segment details already known in our systems. By pulling attributes from CRM and Customer_Analyzer—such as ICP/segment, region, and regulated/industry flags—we can pre-select items like security review, DPA, and retention constraints when a theme/issue is linked to impacted customers.

The primary product impact is reducing manual triage and guesswork for PMs, Eng, and Compliance when preparing a deployment. Instead of relying on someone to remember which requirements apply for a given customer profile, the checklist will consistently reflect the derived “required for deployment” set, improving accuracy and repeatability across teams and releases.

We’ll also surface gaps earlier by highlighting when required items are missing or incomplete relative to the derived set. This should reduce late-stage discovery of compliance blockers, prevent last-minute launch delays, and lower the risk of deploying without meeting customer-specific obligations—especially for regulated segments and non-default regions.

Importantly, this delivers these benefits without changing the existing checklist UI or workflow: the same checklist remains the source of truth, but it becomes automatically pre-filled and validated based on linked customer context. This keeps adoption friction low while increasing confidence that “ready for deployment” actually means compliant for the impacted customers.
